title: Turbopack break icon.svg proper Chrome rendering (sizes="any" becomes sizes="{width}x{height}"

labels.name: linear: turbopack
labels.description: Confirmed issue that is tracked by the Turbopack team.

body:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/funny-dewdney-xrmxz4

### To Reproduce

1. Start the app
2. Go to the preview in Chrome

Repeat with `--turbopack` flag and get different result for generated `<link rel="icon"` 

### Current vs. Expected behavior

# Currently

## without turbopack (generated code is fine).

```html
<link rel="icon" href="/favicon.ico" type="image/x-icon" sizes="16x16">
<link rel="icon" href="/icon.svg?d9c098aa44bbd609" type="image/svg+xml" sizes="any">
```

Whatever the size, Chrome will choose the SVG.

## With `--turbopack`

```html
<link rel="icon" href="/favicon.ico?favicon.45db1c09.ico" sizes="256x256" type="image/x-icon">
<link rel="icon" href="/icon.svg?icon.9bc33653.svg" sizes="512x512" type="image/svg+xml">
```

If SVG size is > to favicon, Chrome will use the favicon (which can be the case for most actual real world usage)

# Expected

With turbo pack,  `icon.svg` should still have `sizes="any"`

### Provide environment information

```bash
Operating System:
  Platform: linux
  Arch: x64
  Version: #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Sun Aug  6 20:05:33 UTC 2023
  Available memory (MB): 4242
  Available CPU cores: 2
Binaries:
  Node: 20.9.0
  npm: 9.8.1
  Yarn: 1.22.19
  pnpm: 8.10.2
Relevant Packages:
  next: 15.4.0-canary.7 // Latest available version is detected (15.4.0-canary.7).
  eslint-config-next: N/A
  react: 19.1.0
  react-dom: 19.1.0
  typescript: 5.3.3
Next.js Config:
  output: N/A
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Turbopack, Metadata

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

next dev (local), next build (local)

### Additional context

_No response_
